{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3266764,"name":"Jason Daming","username":"jdaming","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jdaming/{size}/137720_2.png","created_at":"2023-12-19T00:59:54.899Z","cooked":"

What does your team do to the joystick inputs before passing them to the robot?

  • Square (or Cube) the inputs?
  • Deadband?
  • Cap the output?
  • Multiply by a scalar?
  • Slew Rate Limiter?
  • Set a minimum output?
  • Do you have a different strategy for rotation vs translation?
  • What output: %, V, Speed, Amperage, Torque?
","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2023-12-19T00:59:54.899Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":268,"reads":191,"readers_count":190,"score":1393.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":446545,"topic_slug":"swerve-joystick-control-strategy","display_username":"Jason Daming","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":18342,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"WPILib Developer (Documentation), CSA"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-joystick-control-strategy/446545/1","custom_user_title":"WPILib Developer (Documentation), CSA","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3266768,"name":"Ian Saam","username":"Enjsnake","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/enjsnake/{size}/201559_2.png","created_at":"2023-12-19T01:11:59.747Z","cooked":"

I can really only speak to the input rates, for turning we have our input raised to the 3/2. …yes I know. We tried changing it from linear to squared and I felt it was a bit of a drastic difference, so we kind of split the middle. For translation, it’s just linear.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2023-12-19T01:11:59.747Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":185,"readers_count":184,"score":67.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":446545,"topic_slug":"swerve-joystick-control-strategy","display_username":"Ian Saam","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52963,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3128 Strategic Design Lead & Driver"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-joystick-control-strategy/446545/2","custom_user_title":"3128 Strategic Design Lead & Driver","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3266803,"name":"Steven Carmain","username":"Steven_Carmain","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/f07891/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-12-19T02:52:48.388Z","cooked":"

For our swerve: Thrustmaster Joysticks, read linearly
We have an internal deadband function for Xbox Controllers when zero centering is bad
Usually multiply by scalar to output units (could be m/s or V or %)
We cap driver speed and ramp it up with comfort
No minimum output usually
Swerve wheels have independent acceleration limiters on both the drive and turn

For output control:

  • Swerve Drive, speed via motor controller PID
  • Swerve Turn, voltage request (from a software PID) converted to a % (we started with the 2021 WpiLib template which was software PID, but commanding a brushless speed controller, so we divide by battery voltage, which is probably all wrong)
  • Our arm, we started with software PID, then made it software profiled pid, then added f term for gravity compensation, then switched to hardware pid with motion magic
    • Software PID got it running, profiled pid smoothed it out for wear, f term compensated for gravity much better, and then the hardware pid runs at 1ms and fixed most of our gear stripping issues
  • Intake was voltage control

Well seeing as how I mentor an all girls school that is quite the assumption.

I am not asking for our driver. I asking because:

  1. I want to understand what strategies are most popular.
  2. I want to understand what strategies a library should support
  3. I want to understand if anyone has any fancy new ideas to try (like on discord I heard about a one sided slew rate limiter which seems like an interesting idea to try).

8738 SLICE - 2024 Open Alliance Build Thread Open Alliance
11/2/2023 Programming Deep Dive After the 2023 season, Slice decided to make some significant physical upgrades to our robot during the offseason in preparation for the 2023 THOR and Doyenne competitions, and the code was updated to reflect these changes. Here’s a summary of the most important problems we faced and innovations we made during this process. Swerve Drive: A 3-Part Tragedy This year was our first using swerve drive, which meant big changes for our drivetrain code, and also a whole …

This post about polar joystick filters would be nice.
